verses.text: \w Woe|strong="H1945"\w* unto them that \w decree|strong="H2710"\w* \w unrighteous|strong="H0205"\w* \w decrees|strong="H2711"\w*, and that \w write|strong="H3789"\w* \w grievousness|strong="H5999"\w* \add which\add* they have \w prescribed|strong="H3789"\w*;\f + \fr 10.1 \ft that write…: or, to the writers that write grievousness\f*

To turn \w aside|strong="H5186"\w* the \w needy|strong="H1800"\w* from \w judgment|strong="H1779"\w*, and to take \w away|strong="H1497"\w* the \w right|strong="H4941"\w* from the \w poor|strong="H6041"\w* of my \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, that \w widows|strong="H0490"\w* may be their \w prey|strong="H7998"\w*, and \add that\add* they may \w rob|strong="H0962"\w* the \w fatherless|strong="H3490"\w*!

And what will ye \w do|strong="H6213"\w* in the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* of \w visitation|strong="H6486"\w*, and in the \w desolation|strong="H7722"\w* \add which\add* shall \w come|strong="H0935"\w* from \w far|strong="H4801"\w*? to whom will ye \w flee|strong="H5127"\w* for \w help|strong="H5833"\w*? and where will ye \w leave|strong="H5800"\w* your \w glory|strong="H3519"\w*?

Without me they \w shall|strong="H1115"\w* bow \w down|strong="H3766"\w* under the \w prisoners|strong="H0616"\w*, and they shall \w fall|strong="H5307"\w* under the \w slain|strong="H2026"\w*. For all this his \w anger|strong="H0639"\w* is not turned \w away|strong="H7725"\w*, but his \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* \add is\add* stretched out \w still|strong="H5186"\w*.

¶ \w O|strong="H1945"\w* \w Assyrian|strong="H0804"\w*, the \w rod|strong="H7626"\w* of mine \w anger|strong="H0639"\w*, and the \w staff|strong="H4294"\w* in their \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* is mine \w indignation|strong="H2195"\w*.\f + \fr 10.5 \ft O…: or, Woe to the Assyrian: Heb. Asshur\f*\f + \fr 10.5 \ft and: or, though\f*

I will \w send|strong="H7971"\w* him against an \w hypocritical|strong="H2611"\w* \w nation|strong="H1471"\w*, and against the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of my \w wrath|strong="H5678"\w* will I give him a \w charge|strong="H6680"\w*, to \w take|strong="H7997"\w* the \w spoil|strong="H7998"\w*, and to \w take|strong="H0962"\w* the \w prey|strong="H0957"\w*, and to tread them \w down|strong="H7760"\w* like the \w mire|strong="H2563"\w* of the \w streets|strong="H2351"\w*.\f + \fr 10.6 \ft tread…: Heb. lay them a treading\f*

Howbeit he \w meaneth|strong="H1819"\w* not so, neither doth his \w heart|strong="H3824"\w* \w think|strong="H2803"\w* so; but \add it is\add* in his \w heart|strong="H3824"\w* to \w destroy|strong="H8045"\w* and cut \w off|strong="H3772"\w* \w nations|strong="H1471"\w* not a \w few|strong="H4592"\w*.
For he \w saith|strong="H0559"\w*, \add Are\add* not my \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* \w altogether|strong="H3162"\w* \w kings|strong="H4428"\w*?

\add Is\add* not \w Calno|strong="H3641"\w* as \w Carchemish|strong="H3751"\w*? \add is\add* not \w Hamath|strong="H2574"\w* as \w Arpad|strong="H0774"\w*? \add is\add* not \w Samaria|strong="H8111"\w* as \w Damascus|strong="H1834"\w*?

As my \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* hath \w found|strong="H4672"\w* the \w kingdoms|strong="H4467"\w* of the \w idols|strong="H0457"\w*, and whose graven \w images|strong="H6456"\w* did excel them of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* and of \w Samaria|strong="H8111"\w*;

Shall I not, as I have \w done|strong="H6213"\w* unto \w Samaria|strong="H8111"\w* and her \w idols|strong="H0457"\w*, so \w do|strong="H6213"\w* to \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* and her \w idols|strong="H6091"\w*?

Wherefore it shall come to pass, \add that\add* when the \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w* hath \w performed|strong="H1214"\w* his whole \w work|strong="H4639"\w* upon \w mount|strong="H2022"\w* \w Zion|strong="H6726"\w* and on \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, I will \w punish|strong="H6485"\w* the \w fruit|strong="H6529"\w* of the \w stout|strong="H1433"\w* \w heart|strong="H3824"\w* of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Assyria|strong="H0804"\w*, and the \w glory|strong="H8597"\w* of his \w high|strong="H7312"\w* \w looks|strong="H5869"\w*.\f + \fr 10.12 \ft punish: Heb. visit upon\f*\f + \fr 10.12 \ft stout…: Heb. greatness of the heart\f*

For he \w saith|strong="H0559"\w*, By the \w strength|strong="H3581"\w* of my \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* I have \w done|strong="H6213"\w* \add it\add*, and by my \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w*; for I am \w prudent|strong="H0995"\w*: and I have \w removed|strong="H5493"\w* the \w bounds|strong="H1367"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, and have \w robbed|strong="H8154"\w* their \w treasures|strong="H6259"\w*, and I have put \w down|strong="H3381"\w* the \w inhabitants|strong="H3427"\w* like a \w valiant|strong="H0047"\w* \add man:\add*\f + \fr 10.13 \ft a valiant…: or, many people\f*

And my \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* hath \w found|strong="H4672"\w* as a \w nest|strong="H7064"\w* the \w riches|strong="H2428"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*: and as one \w gathereth|strong="H0622"\w* \w eggs|strong="H1000"\w* \add that are\add* \w left|strong="H5800"\w*, have I \w gathered|strong="H0622"\w* all the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*; and there was none that \w moved|strong="H5074"\w* the \w wing|strong="H3671"\w*, or \w opened|strong="H6475"\w* the \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w*, or \w peeped|strong="H6850"\w*.

Shall the \w axe|strong="H1631"\w* \w boast|strong="H6286"\w* itself against him that \w heweth|strong="H2672"\w* therewith? \add or\add* shall the \w saw|strong="H4883"\w* \w magnify|strong="H1431"\w* itself against him that \w shaketh|strong="H5130"\w* it? as if the \w rod|strong="H7626"\w* should \w shake|strong="H5130"\w* \add itself\add* against them that lift it \w up|strong="H7311"\w*, \add or\add* as if the \w staff|strong="H4294"\w* should lift \w up|strong="H7311"\w* \add itself, as if it were\add* no \w wood|strong="H6086"\w*.\f + \fr 10.15 \ft the rod…: or, a rod should shake them that lift it up\f*\f + \fr 10.15 \ft itself, as if…: or, that which is not wood\f*

Therefore shall the \w Lord|strong="H0113"\w*, the \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w* of \w hosts|strong="H6635"\w*, \w send|strong="H7971"\w* among his fat \w ones|strong="H4924"\w* \w leanness|strong="H7332"\w*; and under his \w glory|strong="H3519"\w* he shall \w kindle|strong="H3344"\w* a \w burning|strong="H3350"\w* like the burning of a \w fire|strong="H0784"\w*.

And the \w light|strong="H0216"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* shall be for a \w fire|strong="H0784"\w*, and his Holy \w One|strong="H6918"\w* for a \w flame|strong="H3852"\w*: and it shall \w burn|strong="H1197"\w* and \w devour|strong="H0398"\w* his \w thorns|strong="H7898"\w* and his \w briers|strong="H8068"\w* in \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w day|strong="H3117"\w*;

And shall \w consume|strong="H3615"\w* the \w glory|strong="H3519"\w* of his \w forest|strong="H3293"\w*, and of his fruitful \w field|strong="H3759"\w*, both \w soul|strong="H5315"\w* and \w body|strong="H1320"\w*: and they shall be as when a \w standardbearer|strong="H5263"\w* \w fainteth|strong="H4549"\w*.\f + \fr 10.18 \ft both…: Heb. from the soul, and even to the flesh\f*

And the \w rest|strong="H7605"\w* of the \w trees|strong="H6086"\w* of his \w forest|strong="H3293"\w* shall be \w few|strong="H4557"\w*, that a \w child|strong="H5288"\w* may \w write|strong="H3789"\w* them.\f + \fr 10.19 \ft few: Heb. number\f*

¶ And it shall come to pass in that \w day|strong="H3117"\w*, \add that\add* the \w remnant|strong="H7605"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, and such as are \w escaped|strong="H6413"\w* of the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of \w Jacob|strong="H3290"\w*, shall no more \w again|strong="H3254"\w* \w stay|strong="H8172"\w* upon him that \w smote|strong="H5221"\w* them; but shall \w stay|strong="H8172"\w* upon the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, the Holy \w One|strong="H6918"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, in \w truth|strong="H0571"\w*.

The \w remnant|strong="H7605"\w* shall \w return|strong="H7725"\w*, \add even\add* the \w remnant|strong="H7605"\w* of \w Jacob|strong="H3290"\w*, unto the \w mighty|strong="H1368"\w* \w God|strong="H0410"\w*.

For though thy \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* be as the \w sand|strong="H2344"\w* of the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, \add yet\add* a \w remnant|strong="H7605"\w* of them shall \w return|strong="H7725"\w*: the \w consumption|strong="H3631"\w* \w decreed|strong="H2782"\w* shall \w overflow|strong="H7857"\w* with \w righteousness|strong="H6666"\w*.\f + \fr 10.22 \ft of them: Heb. in, or, among, etc\f*\f + \fr 10.22 \ft with: or, in\f*

For the \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w* \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd* of \w hosts|strong="H6635"\w* shall \w make|strong="H6213"\w* a \w consumption|strong="H3617"\w*, even \w determined|strong="H2782"\w*, in the \w midst|strong="H7130"\w* of all the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*.

¶ Therefore thus \w saith|strong="H0559"\w* the \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w* \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd* of \w hosts|strong="H6635"\w*, O my \w people|strong="H5971"\w* that \w dwellest|strong="H3427"\w* in \w Zion|strong="H6726"\w*, be not \w afraid|strong="H3372"\w* of the \w Assyrian|strong="H0804"\w*: he shall \w smite|strong="H5221"\w* thee with a \w rod|strong="H7626"\w*, and shall lift \w up|strong="H5375"\w* his \w staff|strong="H4294"\w* against thee, after the \w manner|strong="H1870"\w* of \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w*.\f + \fr 10.24 \ft and shall…: or, but he shall lift up his staff for\f*

For yet a \w very|strong="H4213"\w* little \w while|strong="H4592"\w*, and the \w indignation|strong="H2195"\w* shall \w cease|strong="H3615"\w*, and mine \w anger|strong="H0639"\w* in their \w destruction|strong="H8399"\w*.

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of \w hosts|strong="H6635"\w* shall stir \w up|strong="H5782"\w* a \w scourge|strong="H7752"\w* for him according to the \w slaughter|strong="H4347"\w* of \w Midian|strong="H4080"\w* at the \w rock|strong="H6697"\w* of \w Oreb|strong="H6159"\w*: and \add as\add* his \w rod|strong="H4294"\w* \add was\add* upon the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, so shall he lift it \w up|strong="H5375"\w* after the \w manner|strong="H1870"\w* of \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w*.

And it shall come to pass in that \w day|strong="H3117"\w*, \add that\add* his \w burden|strong="H5448"\w* shall be taken \w away|strong="H5493"\w* from off thy \w shoulder|strong="H7926"\w*, and his \w yoke|strong="H5923"\w* from off thy \w neck|strong="H6677"\w*, and the \w yoke|strong="H5923"\w* shall be \w destroyed|strong="H2254"\w* \w because|strong="H6440"\w* of the \w anointing|strong="H8081"\w*.\f + \fr 10.27 \ft be taken…: Heb. remove\f*

He is \w come|strong="H0935"\w* to \w Aiath|strong="H5857"\w*, he is \w passed|strong="H5674"\w* to \w Migron|strong="H4051"\w*; at \w Michmash|strong="H4363"\w* he hath laid \w up|strong="H6485"\w* his \w carriages|strong="H3627"\w*:

They are gone \w over|strong="H5674"\w* the \w passage|strong="H4569"\w*: they have taken up their \w lodging|strong="H4411"\w* at \w Geba|strong="H1387"\w*; \w Ramah|strong="H7414"\w* is \w afraid|strong="H2729"\w*; \w Gibeah|strong="H1390"\w* of \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* is \w fled|strong="H5127"\w*.

Lift \w up|strong="H6670"\w* thy \w voice|strong="H6963"\w*, O \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* \w of|strong="H1530"\w* \w Gallim|strong="H1554"\w*: cause it to be \w heard|strong="H7181"\w* unto \w Laish|strong="H3919"\w*, O \w poor|strong="H6041"\w* \w Anathoth|strong="H6068"\w*.\f + \fr 10.30 \ft Lift…: Heb. Cry shrill with\f*
\w Madmenah|strong="H4088"\w* is \w removed|strong="H5074"\w*; the \w inhabitants|strong="H3427"\w* of \w Gebim|strong="H1374"\w* gather themselves to \w flee|strong="H5756"\w*.

As yet shall he \w remain|strong="H5975"\w* at \w Nob|strong="H5011"\w* that \w day|strong="H3117"\w*: he shall \w shake|strong="H5130"\w* his \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* \add against\add* the \w mount|strong="H2022"\w* of the \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* of \w Zion|strong="H6726"\w*, the \w hill|strong="H1389"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*.

Behold, the \w Lord|strong="H0113"\w*, the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of \w hosts|strong="H6635"\w*, shall \w lop|strong="H5586"\w* the \w bough|strong="H6288"\w* with \w terror|strong="H4637"\w*: and the high \w ones|strong="H7311"\w* of \w stature|strong="H6967"\w* \add shall be\add* hewn \w down|strong="H1438"\w*, and the \w haughty|strong="H1364"\w* shall be \w humbled|strong="H8213"\w*.

And he shall cut \w down|strong="H5362"\w* the \w thickets|strong="H5442"\w* of the \w forest|strong="H3293"\w* with \w iron|strong="H1270"\w*, and \w Lebanon|strong="H3844"\w* shall \w fall|strong="H5307"\w* by a mighty \w one|strong="H0117"\w*.\f + \fr 10.34 \ft by…: or, mightily\f*
